widgets.title: Daily Ingest Rate By Account (Time Series)

nrqlQueries.query: SELECT rate(sum(GigabytesIngested), 1 day) AS 'Daily Ingest Rate' FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' TIMESERIES AUTO since 9 months ago facet consumingAccountName limit max

SELECT rate(sum(GigabytesIngested), 30 day) AS '30 Day Rate' FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' since 30 days ago limit max compare with 1 month ago TIMESERIES 7 days

SELECT rate(sum(GigabytesIngested), 30 day) AS avgGbIngest FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' since 30 days ago facet usageMetric limit max compare with 1 month ago

SELECT rate(sum(GigabytesIngested), 30 day) AS avgGbIngest FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' since 30 days ago facet consumingAccountName limit max compare with 1 month ago

SELECT rate(sum(GigabytesIngested), 1 day) AS 'Daily Rate' FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' since 30 days ago limit max compare with 1 month ago

SELECT sum(GigabytesIngested) AS '30 Day Sum' FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' since 30 days ago limit max compare with 1 month ago

SELECT derivative(GigabytesIngested, 7 day) AS 'GB Ingest Derivative' FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' TIMESERIES AUTO since 9 months ago limit max facet usageMetric

rawConfiguration.text:
## Relevant NR1 Docs

### Solutions Guides

[Data Governance Solutions Guide](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/introduction)

### Technical Docs

[Manage Incoming Data](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/data-apis/manage-data/manage-data-coming-new-relic/)

[Data Management Hub](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/data-apis/manage-data/manage-your-data/)

[Drop Data Using Nerdgraph](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/data-apis/manage-data/drop-data-using-nerdgraph/)

[Alert on Data Ingest Anomalies](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/accounts/accounts-billing/new-relic-one-pricing-billing/usage-queries-alerts/)

nrqlQueries.query: SELECT sum(GigabytesIngested) AS 'gb_ingest_30_day_sum', rate(sum(GigabytesIngested), 1 day) AS 'gb_ingest_daily_rate', derivative(GigabytesIngested, 90 day) as 'gb_ingest_90_day_derivative' FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' since 30 days ago facet consumingAccountId, consumingAccountName, usageMetric  limit max

rawConfiguration.text:
# TIP

# For a much deeper view into the sources of ingest that contribute to `InfraIntegrationBytes` Install the *Infrastructure Integration Analysis* [dashboard](https://github.com/newrelic/newrelic-quickstarts/tree/main/quickstarts/audit/infrastructure-integrations-data-analysis) form New Relic I/O.

SELECT rate(sum(GigabytesIngested), 1 day) AS avgGbIngestTimeseries FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' and usageMetric = 'PixieBytes' TIMESERIES AUTO since 9 months ago limit max COMPARE WITH 3 months ago

SELECT rate(sum(GigabytesIngested), 1 day) AS avgGbIngestTimeseries FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' and usageMetric = 'PixieBytes' TIMESERIES AUTO since 9 months ago limit max facet consumingAccountName

SELECT sum(GigabytesIngested) AS avgGbIngestTimeseries FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' and usageMetric = 'PixieBytes' since 1 months ago limit max facet consumingAccountName

SELECT sum(GigabytesIngested) AS avgGbIngest FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' and usageMetric = 'PixieBytes' since 30 days ago limit max compare with 1 month ago

SELECT rate(sum(GigabytesIngested), 30 day) AS avgGbIngest FROM NrConsumption WHERE ((timestamp < 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter != 'product-rating-emitters') or (timestamp >= 1691640000000 and nr.sourceEmitter = 'product-rating-emitters')) AND productLine='DataPlatform' and usageMetric = 'PixieBytes' since 30 days ago facet consumingAccountName limit max compare with 1 month ago

rawConfiguration.text:
## This dashboard is part of the [Data Ingest Governance](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-intro/) framework. With the previouse pages in this dashboard, we have a good understanding what type of data has been reported to New Relic. 

## We probably have an idea which part of the data we want to reduce its ingestion. If not, check out this doc on [Prioritize your observability objectives](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#prioritize-objectives) and [Develop an optimization plan ](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#develop-plan)

---
## As the next step, we would like to add the [Data Governance Entity Breakdowns](https://one.newrelic.com/nr1-core?state=437b95b0-f779-9832-e64c-b495f7bd9e76) dashboard to the consuming accounts we'd like to reduce data ingestion. Then we can follow the below linked docs to optimize the data ingestion. There are two options to achieve that.

---
## Optimize data ingestion by agent configuration:
This is a clean way to manage the data reporting to New Relic while it does require manual configurations for most of the cases.
- [APM agent](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#apm-agent)
- [Browser agent](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#apm-agent)
- [Mobile agent](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#mobile-agent)
- [Infrastructure agent](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#infrastructure-agent)
- [Kubernetes Integration](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#k8s-integration)
- [On-host integrations](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#on-host-integrations)
- [Network Performance Monitoring (NPM)](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#network-performance-monitoring)
- [Log forwarders](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#log-forwarders)
- [Prometheus Metrics Sources](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#prometheus-metrics-sources)
- [Cloud Integrations](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#cloud-integration)

---
## Optimization with drop rules
Drop filter provides a central place to manage data ingestion in New Relic. The benefit of this option is that you don't have to config the agents or integrations in each services/hosts. In addition, you can quickly remove a drop filter rule to get the data report back immediately. 
The downside is that you'll still have the data egress if this is something needs to be considered. 
Check out the doc for some exmples: https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/new-relic-solutions/observability-maturity/operational-efficiency/dg-optimizing#optimization-with-drop-rules
